channel.title: Lycx

item.title: Lycx
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

If you want to use NIO in this I suggest you wait until OrathanAPI has its NIO reactor design added. It will apply a simple TCP NIO server, which Runescape’s codec can easily be applied to. There isn’t need for a massive library like MINA or Netty in a Runescape Private Server.

Read full topic

item.title: Lycx
item.dc:creator: @WW1 WW
item.description:
@WW1 wrote:

[center]I am watching howl’s moving castle as I type this thread, so please excuse any spelling errors as my eyes are on the video and my fingers are typing

I started with an old favourate for my server, a particular revision winterlove now called blakescape. I had noticed a lot of popular servers had created something from this, or had created something entirely from scratch. Because I am uncapable to create networking, then do whatever comes after I’ve decided just to use something I have been somewhat successful before by created several servers that have reached aprox. 30 player at 90% of the time but back then this was common for a silabsoft server so this isn’t a big accomplishment for me personally but I can’t say it didn’t feel good running a community and creating a game for the first time. I started by cleaning up every file to ensure that it was easier for me to look through and edit - this was something I did for myself not for a release to the downloads section, I did however create a thread for my development on cleaning it. People supported my progress and as Tatemo explained to me:[/center]

[quote=“Tatemo, post:6, topic:361848”]Looks nice enough. But you are doing conventions wrong. Read some java tutorials

The files need to be indented by the brackets and generally in Java it goes:

public class blah { (Bracket on same line now next Palidino was just a moron)
[Tab] void blarg() {
[tab][tab]
[tab]}
}

Other than that pretty good I guess :)[/quote][center]
Because what I was changing as I cleaned is I moved the { onto a new line,
[/center]private int burntFish(int i) { switch (i) { case 317: case 321: return 323; }; };[center]
But personally what’s wrong with being a little different, players wont even notice as long as it’s efficient and or provides some decent content to keep them active currently I’m working on skills then focusing on combat aspects like weapon specials, prayer bonuses aswell as prayer playing a part in combat, potions & food .etc. A stated below I am only focusing on 19 skills, I plan on editing the skill menu on a 377 deob to a 289 skill menu, the revision before slayer was released. I personally don’t hate Farming but it is a difficult skill for me to add at the moment, once I become more skilled I hope to make my own version of it where it doesn’t take hours to get a herb or something like a potatoe.[/center]

Development

[ul][li]Skill Development
http://lycx.org/index.php?topic=3.0[list][li]This is a link to my website mentioned in my signature, I use it to update my information of the development and ideas of my server and the thread is a bit large, and I would dislike having to edit it in two, possibly three locations so I’m going to use an external link.[/li][/list][/li][/ul]

Read full topic
